task_summary: Robot arm perceives, approaches, grasps, and lifts a red object from a table, as shown in the 9-frame sequence.

task_long_description.overview: A robot manipulator is tasked with picking up a red cylindrical object from a black tabletop. The arm is initially at rest. The pipeline includes perception of the target object, approaching above it, opening the gripper, computing a grasp pose (top-down), aligning, grasping, verifying grasp stability, and finally lifting with a retreat motion. The sequence is shown in 9 time-ordered frames.
preconditions: Red object is on the table in reachable workspace
stepwise_plan: Check if red object is visible; otherwise, scan up to 3 times
Detect precise pose of red object
Move above red object with vertical offset
Approach and align to object with tight tolerance
success_criteria: Red object is firmly grasped and lifted off the table
failure_and_recovery: If object is not visible: scan up to 3 times
If grasp is unstable: fail and halt sequence
task_long_description.termination: Robot retreats with object after confirming stable grasp

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks whether the red object is in the robot's field of view
Performs grid-pattern scan to find the red object
Detects the location and pose of red object
Opens the gripper to 0.06m width to prepare for grasp
Moves the gripper directly above the red object
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the red object
Approaches and aligns gripper to the red object
Checks for stable force closure of the grasp

recovery_strategy: Retry scanning for object up to 3 times if not visible
assumptions: Assumed the red object is labeled 'red_object' and is the only object manipulated.
Frames [0-8] show ONLY pick; no place is performed (despite instruction suggesting pick-and-place). BT covers only observable sequence.
No conflicting cues between instruction and visual sequence; instruction 'from the table' corresponds to picking up as seen.
Object category (block or cup) is not explicitly set; treated generically as 'red_object'.

expected_success_criteria: Robot lifts red object with a stable grasp; it is no longer in contact with the table.
